TextBlock.Text: PYE: Construction is on schedule, and all readings so far are well within our expected parameters. However, I have concerns about my colleague's state of mind.
PYE: For a few weeks now, I've observed troubling symptoms. These include, but are not limited to, general gooiness, pleasant remarks, and contented sighing.
PYE: He has been daydreaming frequently and I'm sad to report, even smiling. I can only conclude that he has lost his mind, and the fate of the project hangs in the balance.
PYE: I believe this behaviour started as a result of him getting a new... <color=pink>boyfriend</color>.
PYE: In fact, just saying his name brings on an attack of furious blushing! It's adorable.
PYE: I propose a treatment plan of constant teasing and neverending pestering.
IDAEA: There is nothing I can do to escape this, is there?
PYE: Oh, you have no idea how right you are.
IDAEA: More than usual? What could I have done this time?
IDAEA: Oh. Ha ha, very funny.
IDAEA: I am not blushing. Or adorable.
